name: Shrugs with Barbells
how_to_perform:
1. Stand or sit with your back straight, holding a pair of dumbbells at shoulder height with an overhand grip (palms facing away from you).

2. Keeping your upper arms still, engage your core and lift the dumbbells straight up so that they are just below your clavicles.

3. Pause briefly for a split second to squeeze your scapulae (shoulder blades) together.

4. Slowly lower the dumbbells back to their starting position at shoulder height, keeping control throughout the movement.

5. Repeat this process for the desired number of repetitions, maintaining proper form and avoiding any unnecessary strain on your joints.
short_summary: Shrugs with barbells are an upper body exercise that targets the scapular muscles, performed by lifting weight off the shoulders.
